actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture.

official_title: A bill to amend the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 to replace the prohibition on higher State make allowances for the processing of milk with a requirement that the support purchase price for milk be reduced if a person collects a State make allowance that is higher than the Federal make allowance and the milk is purchased by the Commodity Credit Corporation, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Amends the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 with regard to milk manufacturing marketing adjustments to replace the existing prohibition on States having a higher processing allowance than the Federal allowance with a requirement that the Commodity Credit Corporation reduce the price it pays a person (including cooperatives) for surplus milk and milk products in a State with a higher allowance by an amount equal to the Federal-State allowance difference. Eliminates related penalty provisions.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 to replace the prohibition on higher State make allowances for the processing of milk with a requirement that the support purchase price for milk be reduced if a person collects a State make allowance that is higher than the Federal make allowance and the milk is purchased by the Commodity Credit Corporation, and for other purposes.
